Medicine_98.News Finding:
CONCLUSIONS:

Our findings raise the prospect that the tissues harvested from equine ligaments up to 72 hours of post-mortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cells.
Medicine_98.Paper Finding: The present work is the first, in both animal and human, to show that tissues harvested from cadaveric ligaments up to 72 hours postmortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cell populations.
Medicine_98.News Context:
Furthermore, TEM analysis confirmed the stemness of EC-MSCs and identified some cells with a typical neuronal morphology. CONCLUSIONS:

Our findings raise the prospect that the tissues harvested from equine ligaments up to 72 hours of post-mortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cells. EC-MSCs could be a promising alternative source for tissue engineering and stem cell therapy in equine medicine.
Medicine_98.Paper Context: Taking these observations into account, fundamental and clinical research studies are now required to investigate whether MSCs isolated from equine cadavers are suitable, abundant, and readily available to be used in future clinical applications. The present work is the first, in both animal and human, to show that tissues harvested from cadaveric ligaments up to 72 hours postmortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cell populations. SLs were confirmed free of any damage following examination of the tissues both macroscopically and microscopically.
Medicine_98.text:
['Finding A: CONCLUSIONS: Our findings raise the prospect that the tissues harvested from equine ligaments up to 72 hours of post-mortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cells.
Finding B: The present work is the first, in both animal and human, to show that tissues harvested from cadaveric ligaments up to 72 hours postmortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cell populations.']
Medicine_98.displayed_text:
Finding A: CONCLUSIONS: Our findings raise the prospect that the tissues harvested from equine ligaments up to 72 hours of post-mortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cells.
Finding B: The present work is the first, in both animal and human, to show that tissues harvested from cadaveric ligaments up to 72 hours postmortem represent an available reservoir of specific stem cell populations.

Medicine_tweet_117.News Finding: Meta-analysis evaluating aspirin for primary prevention in cardiovascular disease – the double-edged sword: NNT 265  (to prevent CV mortality/nonfatal MI + stroke); NNH 210 (major bleeding). #JAMA #CVD
Medicine_tweet_117.Paper Finding: The current study demonstrates that the absolute risk reduction for cardiovascular events and absolute risk increase for major bleeding associated with aspirin use were of similar magnitude.
Medicine_tweet_117.News Context: Meta-analysis evaluating aspirin for primary prevention in cardiovascular disease – the double-edged sword: NNT 265  (to prevent CV mortality/nonfatal MI + stroke); NNH 210 (major bleeding). #JAMA #CVD
Medicine_tweet_117.Paper Context: 6 This study showed that when analysis was restricted to populations with observation-derived 10-year cardiovascular event rate estimates of 10% or more, aspirin use was associated with an absolute risk decrease of 0.51% (5% CI, 0.06%-0.3%) for the cardiovascular composite outcome, but an absolute risk increase of 0.64% (5% CI, 0.35%-0.7%) for major bleeding. The current study demonstrates that the absolute risk reduction for cardiovascular events and absolute risk increase for major bleeding associated with aspirin use were of similar magnitude. Aspirin use was not associated with a reduction in cardiovascular mortality, and deaths due to bleeding were rare.
Medicine_tweet_117.text:
['Finding A: Meta-analysis evaluating aspirin for primary prevention in cardiovascular disease – the double-edged sword: NNT 265 (to prevent CV mortality/nonfatal MI + stroke); NNH 210 (major bleeding). #JAMA #CVD\n
Finding B: The current study demonstrates that the absolute risk reduction for cardiovascular events and absolute risk increase for major bleeding associated with aspirin use were of similar magnitude.']
Medicine_tweet_117.displayed_text:
Finding A: Meta-analysis evaluating aspirin for primary prevention in cardiovascular disease – the double-edged sword: NNT 265 (to prevent CV mortality/nonfatal MI + stroke); NNH 210 (major bleeding). #JAMA #CVD
Finding B: The current study demonstrates that the absolute risk reduction for cardiovascular events and absolute risk increase for major bleeding associated with aspirin use were of similar magnitude.

Medicine_66.News Finding: We further found that PC increased H2S production rate and CSE expressions, and protected young hearts from I/R-induced cardiomyocytes damage, all of which were disappeared in the aging hearts.
Medicine_66.Paper Finding: Taken together, our results indicated that aging rat hearts suffered from I/R injury and PC did not improve this injury.
Medicine_66.News Context: I/R also increased the release of cytochrome c and down-regulated the phosphorylation of PI3K, Akt and GSK-3b in the aging rat hearts. We further found that PC increased H2S production rate and CSE expressions, and protected young hearts from I/R-induced cardiomyocytes damage, all of which were disappeared in the aging hearts. Supply of NaHS not only increased PC-induced cardioprotection in the young hearts, but also lightened I/R induced-myocardial damage and significantly recovered the cardioprotective role of PC against I/R induced myocardial damage in the aging hearts.
Medicine_66.Paper Context: PC did not change the above mentioned indexes in comparison with the I/R (Figures 3, 4, 5 and 6 ). Taken together, our results indicated that aging rat hearts suffered from I/R injury and PC did not improve this injury. H 2 S produced by CSE in cardiovascular system acted as a physiological cardiac function regulator, which protected the cardiac function in ischemic reperfusion or hypoxia .
Medicine_66.text:
['Finding A: We further found that PC increased H2S production rate and CSE expressions, and protected young hearts from I/R-induced cardiomyocytes damage, all of which were disappeared in the aging hearts.
Finding B: Taken together, our results indicated that aging rat hearts suffered from I/R injury and PC did not improve this injury.']
Medicine_66.displayed_text:
Finding A: We further found that PC increased H2S production rate and CSE expressions, and protected young hearts from I/R-induced cardiomyocytes damage, all of which were disappeared in the aging hearts.
Finding B: Taken together, our results indicated that aging rat hearts suffered from I/R injury and PC did not improve this injury.

Medicine_tweet_49.News Finding: Lianas reduce tropical forests' #carbon accumulation and storage   #TheTarzanEffect
Medicine_tweet_49.Paper Finding: This study is the first direct demonstration of liana effects at the ecosystem scale and illustrates the important role of lianas in tropical forests, particularly with respect to carbon budgets.
Medicine_tweet_49.News Context: Lianas reduce tropical forests' #carbon accumulation and storage   #TheTarzanEffect
Medicine_tweet_49.Paper Context: By impacting on tree growth and survival, lianas impact the carbon balance of these forests. This study is the first direct demonstration of liana effects at the ecosystem scale and illustrates the important role of lianas in tropical forests, particularly with respect to carbon budgets. Lianas are increasing in biomass and productivity throughout the tropics, and thus our findings have even greater relevance in terms of the fate of the tropical carbon balance, as well as for global atmospheric CO 2 levels, in a changing climate.
Medicine_tweet_49.text:
['Finding A: Lianas reduce tropical forests\' #carbon accumulation and storage #TheTarzanEffect
Finding B: This study is the first direct demonstration of liana effects at the ecosystem scale and illustrates the important role of lianas in tropical forests, particularly with respect to carbon budgets.']
Medicine_tweet_49.displayed_text:
Finding A: Lianas reduce tropical forests' #carbon accumulation and storage #TheTarzanEffect
Finding B: This study is the first direct demonstration of liana effects at the ecosystem scale and illustrates the important role of lianas in tropical forests, particularly with respect to carbon budgets.

Medicine_125.News Context:
Insecticide Armor

Further investigation revealed that all of these "overexpressed" genes were active in the tough outer shell of resistant bedbugs, and either helped neutralize pyrethroid insecticides before they could take effect or prevented them from entering the insects' bodies in the first place. The study also revealed that despite sometimes being separated by hundreds of miles, resistant bedbug colonies utilized many of the same genes to protect themselves against pyrethroid insecticides. Bedbugs by themselves aren't very mobile, but Haynes suspects the bugs are catching rides with humansaor rather, their furniture.
Medicine_125.Paper Context: 3D) is also interesting and further research is required to understand functional significance of this observation. Our data showed that multiple mechanisms involved in pyrethroid resistance is not only a phenomenon occurring in laboratory bed bug strains but also is widespread in naturally occurring bed bug populations (Figs. Inactivation of four P450 target genes significantly enhanced the susceptibility of resistant bed bugs to pyrethroid insecticide, which further confirmed the involvement of P450-mediated metabolic detoxification in pyrethroid resistance of bed bugs.

Medicine_337.News Finding: They found that the two methods are comparable in accuracy when checked against actual survey-based census data, but estimates from mobile phone data can provide more timely information, down to the hours.
Medicine_337.Paper Finding: This study demonstrates how data collected by mobile phone network operators can costeffectively provide accurate and detailed maps of population distribution over national scales and any time period while guaranteeing phone users' privacy.
Medicine_337.News Context: During the holiday season, populations in cities dropped sharply, while tourist sites such as coastlines and Disneyland Paris boomed. They found that the two methods are comparable in accuracy when checked against actual survey-based census data, but estimates from mobile phone data can provide more timely information, down to the hours. To apply it in other countries, the team would need to adjust the model to account for diverse mobile phone usage patterns.
Medicine_337.Paper Context: The global MP penetration Significance Knowing where people are is critical for accurate impact assessments and intervention planning, particularly those focused on population health, food security, climate change, conflicts, and natural disasters. This study demonstrates how data collected by mobile phone network operators can costeffectively provide accurate and detailed maps of population distribution over national scales and any time period while guaranteeing phone users' privacy. The methods outlined may be applied to estimate human population densities in lowincome countries where data on population distributions may be scarce, outdated, and unreliable, or to estimate temporal variations in population density.
Medicine_337.text:
['Finding A: They found that the two methods are comparable in accuracy when checked against actual survey-based census data, but estimates from mobile phone data can provide more timely information, down to the hours.
Finding B: This study demonstrates how data collected by mobile phone network operators can costeffectively provide accurate and detailed maps of population distribution over national scales and any time period while guaranteeing phone users\' privacy.']
Medicine_337.displayed_text:
Finding A: They found that the two methods are comparable in accuracy when checked against actual survey-based census data, but estimates from mobile phone data can provide more timely information, down to the hours.
Finding B: This study demonstrates how data collected by mobile phone network operators can costeffectively provide accurate and detailed maps of population distribution over national scales and any time period while guaranteeing phone users' privacy.

Medicine_92.News Finding: Declines in the frequency of vaginal and oral sexual behaviors occurred irrespective of tumor HPV status.
Medicine_92.Paper Finding: Awareness of this link between sexual behavior, oral HPV infection, and cancer may cause concern for patients who have HPV-positive OSCC and their partners.
Medicine_92.News Context: Investigators also found that abstinence from vaginal sex significantly increased from 10% at baseline to 34% at 6 months (P <.01) and abstinence from oral sex increased from 25% to 80% (P <.01). Declines in the frequency of vaginal and oral sexual behaviors occurred irrespective of tumor HPV status. The findings ultimately suggest that a diagnosis of oropharyngeal cancer can have significant negative effects on sexual behavior.
Medicine_92.Paper Context: Performing oral sex increases the risk of oral HPV infection, and the risk increases with the number of partners. Awareness of this link between sexual behavior, oral HPV infection, and cancer may cause concern for patients who have HPV-positive OSCC and their partners. Strong associations are observed between sexual behavior, oral HPV infection, and oropharyngeal cancer.
Medicine_92.text:
['Finding A: Declines in the frequency of vaginal and oral sexual behaviors occurred irrespective of tumor HPV status.
Finding B: Awareness of this link between sexual behavior, oral HPV infection, and cancer may cause concern for patients who have HPV-positive OSCC and their partners.']
Medicine_92.displayed_text:
Finding A: Declines in the frequency of vaginal and oral sexual behaviors occurred irrespective of tumor HPV status.
Finding B: Awareness of this link between sexual behavior, oral HPV infection, and cancer may cause concern for patients who have HPV-positive OSCC and their partners.

Medicine_tweet_74.News Finding: Parent conversations with children about their weight associated with disordered eating behaviours
Medicine_tweet_74.Paper Finding: This study builds on recent research focusing on fathers and their role in adolescent eating disorders treatment 32, [41] [42] [43] and finds that adolescents whose fathers engaged in weight conversations were significantly more likely to engage in dieting and UWCBs than adolescents whose fathers did not.
Medicine_tweet_74.News Context: Parent conversations with children about their weight associated with disordered eating behaviours
Medicine_tweet_74.Paper Context: This approach may be particularly important for parents of overweight or obese adolescents. This study builds on recent research focusing on fathers and their role in adolescent eating disorders treatment 32, [41] [42] [43] and finds that adolescents whose fathers engaged in weight conversations were significantly more likely to engage in dieting and UWCBs than adolescents whose fathers did not. Thus, it may be important to educate fathers to avoid any form of weight-related conversations with their adolescents.
Medicine_tweet_74.text:
['Finding A: Parent conversations with children about their weight associated with disordered eating behaviours
Finding B: This study builds on recent research focusing on fathers and their role in adolescent eating disorders treatment 32, [41] [42] [43] and finds that adolescents whose fathers engaged in weight conversations were significantly more likely to engage in dieting and UWCBs than adolescents whose fathers did not.']
Medicine_tweet_74.displayed_text:
Finding A: Parent conversations with children about their weight associated with disordered eating behaviours
Finding B: This study builds on recent research focusing on fathers and their role in adolescent eating disorders treatment 32, [41] [42] [43] and finds that adolescents whose fathers engaged in weight conversations were significantly more likely to engage in dieting and UWCBs than adolescents whose fathers did not.

Medicine_tweet_22.News Finding: #medicalresearch The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot osteoarthritis in community-dwelling...
Medicine_tweet_22.Paper Finding: The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA in adults aged 50 years and over was 16.7% (95% CI 15.3% to 18.0%).
Medicine_tweet_22.News Context: #medicalresearch The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot osteoarthritis in community-dwelling...
Medicine_tweet_22.Paper Context: Population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA Population prevalence estimates were almost identical in the baseline responder population and the total baseline eligible mailed population, hence the latter data are presented. The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA in adults aged 50 years and over was 16.7% (95% CI 15.3% to 18.0%). The most commonly affected joint was the 1st MTPJ (7.8%; 95% CI 6.7% to 8.9%), followed by the 2nd CMJ (6.8%; 95% CI 5.7% to 7.8%), TNJ (5.8%; 95% CI 4.8% to 6.9%), NCJ (5.2%; 95% CI 4.0% to 6.4%) and 1st CMJ (3.9%; 95% CI 2.9% to 4.9%) (table 3) .
Medicine_tweet_22.text:
['Finding A: #medicalresearch The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot osteoarthritis in community-dwelling...
Finding B: The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA in adults aged 50 years and over was 16.7% (95% CI 15.3% to 18.0%).']

Finding A: #medicalresearch The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot osteoarthritis in community-dwelling...
Finding B: The population prevalence of symptomatic radiographic foot OA in adults aged 50 years and over was 16.7% (95% CI 15.3% to 18.0%).

Medicine_507.News Finding: The researchers found that when the seals put on enough fat to achieve neutral buoyancy, the number of strokes needed to complete a round-trip from bottom to surface was at its lowest.
Medicine_507.Paper Finding: Seals gradually became more buoyant as they increased their fat stores while foraging over the course of the migration.
Medicine_507.News Context: This means that she's negatively buoyant when she heads back out to sea and can sink into the deep water without swimming very hard. The researchers found that when the seals put on enough fat to achieve neutral buoyancy, the number of strokes needed to complete a round-trip from bottom to surface was at its lowest. "At neutral buoyancy, they're able to spend more time foraging at depth because they're spending less energy moving up and down," said Costa.
Medicine_507.Paper Context: At the start of each migration, all 14 seals were negatively buoyant, as indicated by the negative drift rate values (figure 1; electronic supplementary material, figure S3 ). Seals gradually became more buoyant as they increased their fat stores while foraging over the course of the migration. All seals were still negatively buoyant at the end of the short foraging migration, but five of seven seals became neutrally buoyant by the end of the recording period during the long foraging migration, as indicated by the drift rates being zero (i.e.
Medicine_507.text:
['Finding A: The researchers found that when the seals put on enough fat to achieve neutral buoyancy, the number of strokes needed to complete a round-trip from bottom to surface was at its lowest.
Finding B: Seals gradually became more buoyant as they increased their fat stores while foraging over the course of the migration.']
Medicine_507.displayed_text:
Finding A: The researchers found that when the seals put on enough fat to achieve neutral buoyancy, the number of strokes needed to complete a round-trip from bottom to surface was at its lowest.
Finding B: Seals gradually became more buoyant as they increased their fat stores while foraging over the course of the migration.

Medicine_294.News Finding: These findings do not support the use of otamixaban for patients with NSTE-ACS undergoing planned early percutaneous coronary intervention," the authors conclude.
Medicine_294.Paper Finding: At that time, the rates of the primary efficacy outcome in the higher-dose otamixaban group was 4.7% (the one selected to go forward) and was 5.6% in the UFH-pluseptifibatide group (adjusted RR, 0.848; 95% CI, 0.662-1.087) but the lower-dose group fulfilled the prespecified criteria for futility with a RR of more than 1 (primary efficacy outcome, 6.3%; RR, 1.130; 95% CI, 0.906-1.408) and was discontinued.
Medicine_294.News Context: Study anticoagulant was discontinued because of bleeding in 242 patients (4.7 percent) in the otamixaban group and in 95 patients (1.7 percent) in the UFH-plus-eptifibatide group. "Otamixaban did not reduce ischemic events compared with UFH plus eptifibatide but increased bleeding among patients with NSTE-ACS and a planned invasive strategy. These findings do not support the use of otamixaban for patients with NSTE-ACS undergoing planned early percutaneous coronary intervention," the authors conclude.
Medicine_294.Paper Context: The design of the TAO trial has been published. At that time, the rates of the primary efficacy outcome in the higher-dose otamixaban group was 4.7% (the one selected to go forward) and was 5.6% in the UFH-pluseptifibatide group (adjusted RR, 0.848; 95% CI, 0.662-1.087) but the lower-dose group fulfilled the prespecified criteria for futility with a RR of more than 1 (primary efficacy outcome, 6.3%; RR, 1.130; 95% CI, 0.906-1.408) and was discontinued. Events occurring among patients who received the discontinued otamixaban dose were not considered in primary outcome analyses, which pertained only to participants randomized to the higher dose of otamixaban vs UFH plus eptifibatide, not to the low-dose otamixaban group.
Medicine_294.text:
['Finding A: These findings do not support the use of otamixaban for patients with NSTE-ACS undergoing planned early percutaneous coronary intervention," the authors conclude.
Finding B: At that time, the rates of the primary efficacy outcome in the higher-dose otamixaban group was 4.7% (the one selected to go forward) and was 5.6% in the UFH-pluseptifibatide group (adjusted RR, 0.848; 95% CI, 0.662-1.087) but the lower-dose group fulfilled the prespecified criteria for futility with a RR of more than 1 (primary efficacy outcome, 6.3%; RR, 1.130; 95% CI, 0.906-1.408) and was discontinued.']

Finding A: These findings do not support the use of otamixaban for patients with NSTE-ACS undergoing planned early percutaneous coronary intervention," the authors conclude.
Finding B: At that time, the rates of the primary efficacy outcome in the higher-dose otamixaban group was 4.7% (the one selected to go forward) and was 5.6% in the UFH-pluseptifibatide group (adjusted RR, 0.848; 95% CI, 0.662-1.087) but the lower-dose group fulfilled the prespecified criteria for futility with a RR of more than 1 (primary efficacy outcome, 6.3%; RR, 1.130; 95% CI, 0.906-1.408) and was discontinued.

Medicine_tweet_37.News Finding:
A healthy diet seems to most benefit people with a genetic predisposition to #obesity
 @username #OA
Medicine_tweet_37.Paper Finding: Moreover, the beneficial effect of improved diet quality on weight management was particularly pronounced in people at high genetic risk for obesity.
Medicine_tweet_37.News Context:
A healthy diet seems to most benefit people with a genetic predisposition to #obesity
 @username #OA
Medicine_tweet_37.Paper Context: These data indicate that improving adherence to healthy dietary patterns could attenuate the genetic association with weight gain. Moreover, the beneficial effect of improved diet quality on weight management was particularly pronounced in people at high genetic risk for obesity. Weights reported in questionnaires and measured by technicians were highly correlated (r=0.97 in both studies) in a validation subsample.

['Finding A: A healthy diet seems to most benefit people with a genetic predisposition to #obesity\n @username #OA
